issue.title: [Bug v6]: lerna run test
issue.body: Everything works - but ... `lerna.json` ``` { "packages": [ ... "packages/create-kolibri", ... ], ... } ``` v5 only packages/create-kolibri/package.json was triggert ``` lerna notice cli v5.6.2 lerna info Executing command in 1 package: "npm run test" ``` v6 all package.json in packages/create-kolibri were triggert ``` lerna notice cli v6.0.1 Skipping project found at packages/create-kolibri/templates/next.js since project {{kebab name}} already exists at packages/create-kolibri/templates/angular! Specify a unique name for the project to allow Nx to differentiate between the two projects. Skipping project found at packages/create-kolibri/templates/react since project {{kebab name}} already exists at packages/create-kolibri/templates/angular! Specify a unique name for the project to allow Nx to differentiate between the two projects. Skipping project found at packages/create-kolibri/templates/solid since project {{kebab name}} already exists at packages/create-kolibri/templates/angular! Specify a unique name for the project to allow Nx to differentiate between the two projects. Skipping project found at packages/create-kolibri/templates/static since project {{kebab name}} already exists at packages/create-kolibri/templates/angular! Specify a unique name for the project to allow Nx to differentiate between the two projects. > @public-ui/components:test > @public-ui/components@1.1.10-rc.0 test /Users/moppitz/Workspace/kolibri/lib/packages/library > cross-env NODE_ENV=test stencil test --spec --json --outputFile jest-test-results.json [05:44.1] @stencil/core [05:44.3] v2.18.1 😛 [05:44.8] testing spec files [05:44.9] jest args: --spec --json --outputFile jest-test-results.json --max-workers=8 ```

comment.body:
Here's a quick repro: https://stackblitz.com/edit/node-muuq3n?file=lerna.json

Running `yarn build` with Nx enabled throws the following error:
```
lerna run build
lerna notice cli v6.0.1
lerna ERR! Error: Invalid projects: @foo-org/foo-api, @foo-org/foo-lib
lerna ERR!     at checkForInvalidProjects (/home/projects/node-muuq3n/node_modules/nx/src/command-line/run-many.js:45:15)
lerna ERR!     at projectsToRun (/home/projects/node-muuq3n/node_modules/nx/src/command-line/run-many.js:38:5)
lerna ERR!     at eval (/home/projects/node-muuq3n/node_modules/nx/src/command-line/run-many.js:23:26)
lerna ERR!     at Generator.next (<anonymous>)
lerna ERR! lerna Invalid projects: @foo-org/foo-api, @foo-org/foo-lib
```

With Nx disabled it builds normally.

issue.title: [Bug]: New browser cache location breaks build for Cloud Functions
issue.body:
### Bug description

Steps to reproduce the problem:

1. Depend on puppeteer `19.0.0` in a Cloud Function.
2. Deploy the Cloud Function, the build succeeds.
3. Invoke the Cloud Function, the error below occurs.

My guess is that the new [cache location](https://github.com/puppeteer/puppeteer/pull/9095) is not retained in the final Docker image for the Cloud Function. Although the build (and probably the download of Chromium) succeeds, Chromium is not available at runtime.

While the Cloud Function environment is not a direct concern of the puppeteer project, the caching feature introduced in `19.0.0` makes it hard to reliably install Chromium in an environment where we don't control the build/file system. I've tried playing around with `PUPPETEER_CACHE_DIR`, but again, we have very little guarantees over the build flow and it potentially changing.

Instead of specifying a download location using `PUPPETEER_CACHE_DIR`, is there any way the old behaviour can optionally be turned on, and let `puppeteer` figure out where it's installed? This would avoid having to know the subtlety of the underlying build/file system.

Thanks,

### Puppeteer version

19.0.0

### Node.js version

16

### npm version

8.5.0

### What operating system are you seeing the problem on?

Linux

### Relevant log output

```shell
Error: Could not find expected browser (chrome) locally. Run `npm install` to download the correct Chromium revision (1045629).
```

comment.body: The same thing is happening when building docker images using Kaniko, could it be related?

issue.title: [Bug v6]: lerna run test
issue.body: Everything works - but ... `lerna.json` ``` { "packages": [ ... "packages/create-kolibri", ... ], ... } ``` v5 only packages/create-kolibri/package.json was triggert ``` lerna notice cli v5.6.2 lerna info Executing command in 1 package: "npm run test" ``` v6 all package.json in packages/create-kolibri were triggert ``` lerna notice cli v6.0.1 Skipping project found at packages/create-kolibri/templates/next.js since project {{kebab name}} already exists at packages/create-kolibri/templates/angular! Specify a unique name for the project to allow Nx to differentiate between the two projects. Skipping project found at packages/create-kolibri/templates/react since project {{kebab name}} already exists at packages/create-kolibri/templates/angular! Specify a unique name for the project to allow Nx to differentiate between the two projects. Skipping project found at packages/create-kolibri/templates/solid since project {{kebab name}} already exists at packages/create-kolibri/templates/angular! Specify a unique name for the project to allow Nx to differentiate between the two projects. Skipping project found at packages/create-kolibri/templates/static since project {{kebab name}} already exists at packages/create-kolibri/templates/angular! Specify a unique name for the project to allow Nx to differentiate between the two projects. > @public-ui/components:test > @public-ui/components@1.1.10-rc.0 test /Users/moppitz/Workspace/kolibri/lib/packages/library > cross-env NODE_ENV=test stencil test --spec --json --outputFile jest-test-results.json [05:44.1] @stencil/core [05:44.3] v2.18.1 😛 [05:44.8] testing spec files [05:44.9] jest args: --spec --json --outputFile jest-test-results.json --max-workers=8 ```

comment.body:
Same here.

It seems that NX tries to read projects from `angular.json`, ignoring `"packages"` config in `lerna.json`.

issue.title: New multiselect breaks when using multiple package files
issue.body:
- [X] I have searched for [similar issues](https://github.com/raineorshine/npm-check-updates/issues)
- [X] I am using the latest version of `npm-check-updates`
- [X] I am using `node >= 14`

---

## Steps to Reproduce

.ncurc:

<!-- If you use a .ncurc config file, specify it here. ncu options have a dramatic effect on its behavior. -->

```js
{
    "packageFile": [
        "package.json",
        "packages/*/package.json"
    ]
}
```

Steps:

- run ncu
- toggle items

## Current Behavior

Works for the first package, all other packages throw

`TypeError: Cannot read properties of undefined (reading 'disabled')`

## Expected Behavior

No error.

comment.body:
You get error when you try to toggle updates.

On Thu, 30 Jun 2022, 15:26 Raine Revere, ***@***.***> wrote:

> Hi, thanks for reporting. I ran ncu -i with multiple package files and I
> did not get any errors.
>
> Can you provide your complete .ncurc file and dependencies list so I can
> recreate the repo and try to reproduce?
>
> My setup:
>
> $ cat package.json
>
> {
>
>   "dependencies": {
>
> 	  "ncu-test-v2": "2.0.0"
>
>   }
>
> }
>
> $ cat a/package.json
>
> {
>
>   "dependencies": {
>
> 	  "ncu-test-tag": "1.1.0"
>
>   }
>
> }
>
> $ cat b/package.json
>
> {
>
>   "dependencies": {
>
> 	  "ncu-test-return-version": "2.0.0"
>
>   }
>
> }
>
> ncu -i:
>
> $ ncu -i
>
> Using config file /Users/raine/projects/ncu-issues/1151/.ncurc
>
> Upgrading /Users/raine/projects/ncu-issues/1151/package.json
>
> [====================] 1/1 100%
>
>
>
> ✔ Choose which packages to update ›
>
>
>
>  ncu-test-v2  1.0.0  →  2.0.0
>
>
>
> Run npm install to install new versions.
>
>
>
> Upgrading /Users/raine/projects/ncu-issues/1151/a/package.json
>
> [====================] 1/1 100%
>
>
>
> ✔ Choose which packages to update ›
>
>
>
> All dependencies match the desired package versions :)
>
>
>
> Run npm install to install new versions.
>
>
>
> Upgrading /Users/raine/projects/ncu-issues/1151/b/package.json
>
> [====================] 1/1 100%
>
>
>
> ? Choose which packages to update › Space to deselect. Enter to upgrade.
>
> ❯ ◉ ncu-test-return-version  1.0.0  →  2.0.0
>
>
>
> ncu-test-return-version  1.0.0  →  2.0.0
>
>
>
> Run npm install to install new versions.
>
>

issue.body:
### Bug description

Steps to reproduce the problem:

1. Depend on puppeteer `19.0.0` in a Cloud Function.
2. Deploy the Cloud Function, the build succeeds.
3. Invoke the Cloud Function, the error below occurs.

While the Cloud Function environment is not a direct concern of the puppeteer project, the caching feature introduced in `19.0.0` makes it hard to reliably install Chromium in an environment where we don't control the build/file system. I've tried playing around with `PUPPETEER_CACHE_DIR`, but again, we have very little guarantees over the build flow and it potentially changing.

Instead of specifying a download location using `PUPPETEER_CACHE_DIR`, is there any way the old behaviour can optionally be turned on, and let `puppeteer` figure out where it's installed? This would avoid having to know the subtlety of the underlying build/file system.

### Node.js version

16

### npm version

8.5.0

Specify a unique name for the project to allow Nx to differentiate between the two projects. > @public-ui/components:test > @public-ui/components@1.1.10-rc.0 test /Users/moppitz/Workspace/kolibri/lib/packages/library > cross-env NODE_ENV=test stencil test --spec --json --outputFile jest-test-results.json [05:44.1] @stencil/core [05:44.3] v2.18.1 😛 [05:44.8] testing spec files [05:44.9] jest args: --spec --json --outputFile jest-test-results.json --max-workers=8 ```

comment.body:
Same here.

It seems that NX tries to read projects from `angular.json`, ignoring `"packages"` config in `lerna.json`.

issue.title: New multiselect breaks when using multiple package files
issue.body:
- [X] I have searched for [similar issues](https://github.com/raineorshine/npm-check-updates/issues)
- [X] I am using the latest version of `npm-check-updates`
- [X] I am using `node >= 14`

---

## Steps to Reproduce

.ncurc:

<!-- If you use a .ncurc config file, specify it here. ncu options have a dramatic effect on its behavior. -->

```js
{
    "packageFile": [
        "package.json",
        "packages/*/package.json"
    ]
}
```

Steps:

- run ncu
- toggle items

## Current Behavior

Works for the first package, all other packages throw

`TypeError: Cannot read properties of undefined (reading 'disabled')`

## Expected Behavior

No error.

comment.body:
You get error when you try to toggle updates.

On Thu, 30 Jun 2022, 15:26 Raine Revere, ***@***.***> wrote:

> Hi, thanks for reporting. I ran ncu -i with multiple package files and I
> did not get any errors.
>

> recreate the repo and try to reproduce?
